com.abmash.api
Class HtmlElement

java.lang.Object
  com.abmash.core.element.Element
      com.abmash.api.HtmlElement

public class HtmlElement
extends Element

Representation of an HTML element on the web page.

The HtmlQuery.findFirst() method returns an HtmlElement. See HtmlQuery how to find elements and Browser how to directly find and interact with elements.

Examples:

  • HtmlElement saveButton = browser.click("Save"); directly searches for the button labeled Save and returns the HtmlElement
  • HtmlElement inputField = browser.type("Username", "Jack"); directly searches for the input field labeled Username, enters the specified text and returns the HtmlElement
  • HtmlElement myElement = browser.query().isTitle().isClickable().has("today").findFirst(); directly searches for clickable titles labeled today and returns the HtmlElement

Author:
Alper Ortac
See Also:
Browser, HtmlQuery, HtmlElements

Constructor Detail

HtmlElement

public HtmlElement(Browser browser,
                   org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebElement seleniumElement)
Creates a new HtmlElement instance and caches most important data.

Cached element data is the tag name and inner text. If the page is refreshed or another URL is opened, that data is still available. But, interacting with the element like clicking or typing in will throw an Exception.

Parameters:
browser -
seleniumElement -

public Browser getBrowser()
Gets the associated browser instance for this element.

Returns:
associated browser instance

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Gets the internal id of this element. The same element will have a different id when the page is reloaded. The id is looking like in this example: {390f457d-406b-458a-b4a6-dfebb24aae36}

Returns:
internal id

Returns:
selenium WebElement

click

public HtmlElement click()
Clicks on element.

Note that if the page reloads after a click, all found HtmlElement instances may lose their validity.

Example: 

HtmlElement button = browser.query().isClickable().has("submit").findFirst();
 button.click();

Returns:
this HtmlElement

doubleClick

public HtmlElement doubleClick()
Doubleclicks on element.

Note that if the page reloads after a click, all found HtmlElement instances may lose their validity.

Example: 

HtmlElement file = browser.query().isClickable().has("file").findFirst();
 file.doubleClick();

Returns:
this HtmlElement

rightClick

public HtmlElement rightClick()
Rightclicks on element to open the context menu.

Note that if the page reloads after a click, all found HtmlElement instances may lose their validity.

Example: 

HtmlElement item = browser.query().isClickable().has("item").findFirst();
 item.rightClick();

Returns:
this HtmlElement

hover

public HtmlElement hover()
Hovers on element with the mouse.

The "mouseover" event will be fired on this element.

Example: 

HtmlElement menuLink = browser.query().isClickable().has("menu").findFirst();
 menuLink.hover();

Returns:
this HtmlElement

dragTo

public HtmlElement dragTo(HtmlElement targetElement)
Drags an element with the mouse on another element.

Example: 

HtmlElements products = browser.query().isClickable().has("item").find();
 HtmlElement shoppingCart = browser.query().has("cart").findFirst();
 products.dragTo(shoppingCart);

Parameters:
targetElement - the element to drag the element to
Returns:
this HtmlElement

Example: 

HtmlElement input = browser.query().isTypable().has("name").findFirst();
 input.clear();

Returns:
this HtmlElement

submit

public HtmlElement submit()
Submits the form linked to this element.

Example: 

HtmlElement input = browser.query().isTypable().has("name").findFirst();
 input.submit();

Examples for forms are search inputs, contact forms or login pages. Submitting causes the form to be sent to the server and usually reloads the web page or parts of the page.

Note that if the page reloads after the submit, all found HtmlElement instances may lose their validity.

Returns:
this HtmlElement

keyPress

public HtmlElement keyPress(java.lang.String keyName)
Presses key on element. See Keys for a complete list of possible key names.

Example: 

HtmlElement input = browser.query().isTypable().has("name").findFirst();
 input.keyPress("enter");

Note that keyPress() and keyHold().keyRelease() are equivalent.

Parameters:
keyName - the name of the key, case-insensitive
Returns:
this HtmlElement
See Also:
Keys, keyHold(String), keyRelease(String)

keyHold

public HtmlElement keyHold(java.lang.String keyName)
Holds key on element. See Keys for a complete list of possible key names.

Example: 

HtmlElement item = browser.query().isTypable().has("item").findFirst();
 item.keyHold("ctrl");

Note that keyPress() and keyHold().keyRelease() are equivalent.

Parameters:
keyName - the name of the key, case-insensitive
Returns:
this HtmlElement
See Also:
Keys, keyPress(String), keyRelease(String)

keyRelease

public HtmlElement keyRelease(java.lang.String keyName)
Releases key on element. See Keys for a complete list of possible key names.

Example: 

HtmlElement item = browser.query().isTypable().has("item").findFirst();
 item.keyHold("ctrl");

Note that keyPress() and keyHold().keyRelease() are equivalent.

Parameters:
keyName - the name of the key, case-insensitive
Returns:
this HtmlElement
See Also:
Keys, keyPress(String), keyHold(String)

triggerAction

public void triggerAction(java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String param)
Performs an action on this element. The second parameter is needed for some of them.

List of actions:

  • click: performs a click action. param is optional, if set to "right" it will perform a right click.
  • dblclick: performs a double click action. param is not needed here.
  • type: performs a type action. param is mandatory and indicates the text to type in.
  • keypress: performs a key press action. param is mandatory and indicates the key code.
  • keydown: performs a key hold action. param is mandatory and indicates the key code.
  • keyup: performs a key release action. param is mandatory and indicates the key code.

Parameters:
type - the action to perform on this element
param - additional parameter, may be not needed, optional or mandatory. see list above for details

public HtmlElement getParent()
Gets the parent of this element in the document structure.

Although the term parent refers to the document source code, mostly it also reflects the visual parent of this element.

Returns:
the parent of this element

getTagName

public java.lang.String getTagName()
Gets the tag name of this element.

Example: Given the following HTML source 

<a href="index.html">Link text</a>
getText() returns "a".

Returns:
the tag name of the element

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Gets visible text of element.

Containing HTML source will be omitted. To get the containing HTML source too, use getTextWithSource() instead.

Example: Given the following HTML source 

<a href="path/to/index.html">Link <strong>text</strong></a>
getText() returns "Link text".

Specified by:
getText in class Element
Returns:
the visible text of the element

getTextWithSource

public java.lang.String getTextWithSource()
Gets inner text of element.

Containing HTML source will be returned to. To omit any HTML tags use getText() instead.

Example: Given the following HTML source 

<a href="path/to/index.html">Link <strong>text</strong></a>
getTextWithSource() returns "Link text".

Returns:
the inner text of the element

getUrl

public java.lang.String getUrl()
Extracts an URL out of this element, which are mostly used in <a> and <img> elements.

Returns:
String of the extracted URL, null if no URL was found

getAttribute

public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
Gets the value for the specified attribute name.

Example: Given the following HTML source 

<div id="content" class="container" />
getAttribute("class") returns container

Parameters:
name - the attribute name
Returns:
the value of the attribute, null if attribute not exists

extractDate

public org.joda.time.DateTime extractDate()
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
Extracts date from this element. Currently only the US locale is supported.

Example: given the following HTML element 

<div>Last updated: 5. May 2012</div>
the following code will extract the date 
Date lastUpdated = browser.query().has("Last updated").findOne().extractDate();

Returns:
Date object
Throws:
java.text.ParseException

equals

public boolean equals(HtmlElement otherElement)
Checks if element is equal to other element

Parameters:
otherElement - HtmlElement to compare with
Returns:
true if elements are equal
